metadata.title: USN-5686-3 -- Git vulnerabilities
metadata.description: USN-5686-1 fixed vulnerabilities in Git. This update provides the corresponding updates for Ubuntu 22.10.  Original advisory details:   Cory Snider discovered that Git incorrectly handled certain symbolic links.  An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause an unexpected behaviour.  (CVE-2022-39253)   Kevin Backhouse discovered that Git incorrectly handled certain command strings.  An attacker could possibly use this issue to arbitrary code execution.  (CVE-2022-39260)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5686-3` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  git - 1:2.37.2-1ubuntu1.1 gitweb - 1:2.37.2-1ubuntu1.1 git-gui - 1:2.37.2-1ubuntu1.1 git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.37.2-1ubuntu1.1 gitk - 1:2.37.2-1ubuntu1.1 git-all - 1:2.37.2-1ubuntu1.1 git-mediawiki - 1:2.37.2-1ubuntu1.1 git-daemon-run - 1:2.37.2-1ubuntu1.1 git-man - 1:2.37.2-1ubuntu1.1 git-doc - 1:2.37.2-1ubuntu1.1 git-svn - 1:2.37.2-1ubuntu1.1 git-cvs - 1:2.37.2-1ubuntu1.1 git-email - 1:2.37.2-1ubuntu1.1 No subscription required
